descriptionProfile: Artist, NatGeo Fellow, photographer and filmmaker. Professional speaker. Environmentalist. WWF & IUCN Ambassador. www.mattiasklum.com
Artist, NatGeo Fellow, photographer and filmmaker. Professional speaker. Environmentalist. WWF & IUCN Ambassador. www.mattiasklum.com

posts.description: A female polar bear and her cub in front of the massive Nordenskiöldbreen, Svalbard Norway. However powerful an apex predator, her hunting skills and success is critical for her own survival and for feeding and teaching her cubs to find food for themselves. According to some scientists, polar bears may be just as smart as some apes. Their success at hunting seals in a dynamic arctic environment is one sign of their brain power. This is learned behavior and reveals that polar bears are very intelligent. They are highly cognitive creatures that top the food chain in polar regions. You have to be quite clever to do that. Hunting and trapping a seal is no easy matter. Looking forward to returning to Svalbard with @irisalexandrov #svalbard #polar #polarbears #arctic #protectbiodiversity #stopclimatechange #expedition #mattiasklum #cubs #UN #mom #IQ #mattiasklumworkshop #predator #norway #savethearctic #wwf #iucn #saveourseas #nikonambassador @mattiasklumofficial @mattiasklumcollection @thephotosociety @natgeotravel @natgeo @irisalexandrov

A pair of Geoffroy's spider monkeys hangin' in the rainforest of Osa Peninsula, Costa Rica. This beautiful and endangered primate has a range from Mexico to Panama. This is, alongside the mantled howler,  the largest of the monkeys of Costa Rica with males averaging 8.2 kg (18 lb) and females averaging 7.7 kg (17 lb). It has long, slim arms and a long, prehensile tail. #mattiasklum #savetherainforest #conservation #nikonambassador #spidermonkey #osapeninsula #costarica  @mattiasklumcollection @natgeotravel @natgeo @irisalexandrov

A dry forest in Galapagos, Ecuador waiting for life giving humidity. This enchated group of islands provide a constant flow of photographic opportunities! #saveourseas #protectbiodiversity #mattiasklum #nikonambassador #ecuador #galapagos #sdg @mattiasklumofficial @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov @natgeo @thephotosociety

Filming for our upcoming documentary about the Baltic Sea in Norrtälje archipelago in Sweden with my beloved partner @irisalexandrov and great friend @olahogberg for #balticsea2020 and @tierragrandefilms ! Our second major production dedicated to this amazing sea! Stay tuned! #mattiasklum #nikonambassador #balticsea #protectbiodiversity #alexandrovklum #saveourseas #tierragrandeproductions @irisalexandrov @thephotosociety @natgeo @mattiasklumofficial @mattiasklumcollection @tierragrandefilms

A Brown noddy tern or Common noddy outside a cave in the Galapagos, Ecuador. This beautiful tern, like orher terns, lives in colonies as a safety measure. They are frequently seen on top of the heads of pelicans in the attempt of stealing any leftovers, or by elegantly picking food from the surface of the water or by plunge-diving. The nodding movement when performing the courtship ritual has given them their name. Photographed together with my boys @ansgarklumphotos and @naturebyeinar #protectbiodiversity #sdg #livingthedream #earthday #nikonambassador #noddytern #galapagos #ecuador #cave #mattiasklum @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov @natgeo @thephotosociety

Flying over beautiful Iceland is a multisensory experience. The visual diversity is staggering and contagious. Can't wait to go again with @irisalexandrov to work on our upcoming art series. #peace #mattiasklum #protectbiodiversity #sdg #nikonambassador #iceland #livingthedream @mattiasklumcollection @thephotosociety @natgeo @irisalexandrov

Like ants in the landscape, tourists walk on enormous sand dunes on their way to Deadvlei in Namibia. #africa #namibia #deadvlei #sdg #protectbiodiversity #mattiasklum #peace #nikonambassador @natgeo @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov @thephotosociety

Small fishing vessels from a far on Lake Malawi, the ninth largest lake in the world and the third largest and second deepest lake in Africa. This remakable lake is home to more species of fish than any other lake, including at least 700 species of cichlids. #peace #livingthedream #mattiasklum #lakemalawi #malawi #sdg #stars #africa #protectbiodiversity @irisalexandrov @thephotosociety @natgeo @mattiasklumcollection

Sea trout fishermen near Skillinge, Österlen in my native Sweden. The Baltic Sea is probably one of our World's most beautiful seas, appreciated by far more than the 90 million people living around her. However, the Baltic sea is also one of the most vulnerable and pressured marine ecosystems on the planet. Overfishing, eutrophication and chemical pollution put immense pressure on this nearly landlocked ecosystem... But there is still so much to cherish, love, protect and fight for!  I have, along with my team, followed life around the sea for four years for our upcoming film. Our second major production for #balticsea2020 dedicated to this amazing sea! Stay tuned! #mattiasklum #protectbiodiversity #balticsea #sdg #sweden #livingthedream #balticsea2020 @mattiasklumofficial @irisalexandrov @thephotosociety @mattiasklumcollection

The king cobra, our worlds longest venomous snake photographed on assignment for @natgeo in Malaysian Borneo. This magnificent snake that can grow nearly 6 meters (19,6 feet) feed almost exclusively on other snakes. In this picture an adult "king" is devouring some kind of water snake inches away from my camera. Check out the "glottis", the small opening just behind the tongue, which opens into the trachea, or windpipe. #science #medicine #kingcobra #asia #cobra #borneo #venom #fast #conservation #rainforest #mattiasklum #protectbiodiversity @thephotosociety @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov @natgeotravel @natgeo

On my way to Monaco with @irisalexandrov to screen our film Vamizi -Cradle of Coral! H.S.H. Prince Albert will generously host the high level event in partnership with IUCN, Musée Océonographique de Monaco and WWF. We are jointly hoping to inspire positive change to benefit ocean conservation. Check out the film here: http://www.wwf.se/press/aktuellt/1680874-se-mattias-klums-film-om-vamizis-rika-undervattensvarld #princealbertofmonaco #mattiasklum #ecosystemengineer #ecosystemservices #monaco #protectbiodiversity #saveourseas #sylviaearle #queennoor #mindmakerspr #friendsofvamizi @natgeo @thephotosociety @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov

A hippo in a typical threat display towards a rivaling male in the Shire river, Liwonde National Park, Malawi. Hippos move with great ease in water, "swimming" by kicking their hind feet or simply walking on the bottom. They are well-adapted to an aquatic lifestyle, with small ears, eyes and nostrils set at the top of the head. Their senses are super keen even when submerged in water. By closing its ears and nostrils, the adult can stay under water for as long as six minutes. #protectbiodiversity #livingthedream #mattiasklum #inspiration #hippo #ecosystemservices #ecosystemengineer #malawi @mattiasklumcollection @irisalexandrov @natgeo @thephotosociety

Hard day's work....Photographing or filming venomous snakes such as this beautiful and highly venomous rhinoceros viper (30 centimeters or 12 inches away from me) in Ndoki, Republic of Congo, is always rewarding but sometimes quite challenging! The default position when working with species like this is to try to habituate the snake a bit by approaching it very carefully, and usually and more successfully, with the help from an assistant. Everything can be calm and peaceful until one thing goes wrong... One tiny mistake, one dropped lens cap, one itchy nose or slightly moved soft box... and bang... This kind of potentially scary situation/attack is luckily very uncommon in my career and has only happened when I or my assistants) have been really tired or for some reason become over confident. Cerebral malaria, dengue-fever, typhoid salmonella, global environmental issues, crazy helipilots (irresponsible people) and city traffic is normally what scares me! As I have mentioned previously in my flow, it is the lethal characteristics of snake venom that ironically makes it so valuable and sought after for use in medicinal treatments. The toxic components of snake venom have for example both led to the development of medicine against heart disease, diabetes and Alzheimer's  and this will luckily not affect the wild populations at all! By protecting rainforest and other ecosystems as well as their inhabitants and by using natures wealth sustainably we secure a healthier planet and future for humanity!  #rhinocerosviper #congo #ecosystemservices #venom #bestjobintheworld #conservation #science #death #snake #medicin #photooftheday  #viper #rhino #snake #conservation #rainforest #respect #biodiversity #photooftheday #instagood #love #livingthedream #protectbiodiversity @mattiasklumcollection @natgeo @thephotosociety @irisalexandrov

Winter's last sigh. The art created and shaped by nature is a constant joy and inspiration and so is living and working with wonderful @irisalexandrov Thank you!! #grateful #love #inspiration #passion @irisalexandrov @mattiasklumofficial @mattiasklumcollection @natgeo @thephotosociety

Danum Valley, Sabah, Malaysian Borneo. Working on landscape photography is like meditation to me. It becomes an intellectual, spiritual and sensual journey once I really get into it.  #danumvalley #borneo #protectbiodiversity #meditation #love #sensual #fineart #photooftheday #instagood #mattiasklum #findyourpassion #passion #masterclass @irisalexandrov @mattiasklumcollection @thephotosociety @natgeo

A Baobab tree and the milky way, Botswana. Baobabs trees store water in the trunk (up to 120,000 litres or 32,000 US gallons) to endure tough droughts. They produce faint growth rings, most likely annually, but they are not reliable for aging purposes, because they are difficult to count and usually fade away as the wood ages. Radiocarbon dating has provided data on a few individuals though. A specimen known as Grootboom was dated and found to be at least 1275 years old, making it one of the oldest known angiosperm trees in the world. How amazing is that? #baobabtree #mattiasklum #nikonambassador #protectbiodiversity #botswana #africa #ancient #tree #stars #milkyway @mattiasklumcollection @natgeotravel @thephotosociety @irisalexandrov @natgeo

Closely related to lions, tigers, and jaguars, leopards are definately powerful cats . You'll find them in sub-Saharan Africa, northeast Africa, Central Asia, India, and China. However, many of their populations are endangered, especially outside of Africa. I photographed this female leopard  in Mombo Camp, Botswana. I find them amazingly graceful! #leopard #endangered #cat #pattern #instagood #photooftheday #conservation #safebigcats #mattiasklum #follow #botswana #mombocamp @natgeocreative @bigworldsmallplanet @nikonprofessional @mattiasklumcollection @natgeo @irisalexandrov @mattiasklumofficial
